metadata.Title: CVE-2022-21222 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The package css-what before 2.1.3 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) due to the usage of insecure regular expression in the re_attr variable of index.js. The exploitation of this vulnerability could be triggered via the parse function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-css-what - 5.1.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-css-what package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.1.0-2').
